content.title: Derivation of Planck Length via Dimensional Analysis
content.summary: Step-by-step derivation of the Planck length ℓ_P from fundamental constants c, ℏ, and G using dimensional analysis.

verification.check_dimensions: [ℏG/c³] = [M L² T⁻¹ × M⁻¹ L³ T⁻² / L³ T⁻³] = [L² × L³ / L³ × T⁻¹ × T⁻² × T³] = [L²] → √[L²] = [L] ✓

content.physical_interpretation: The Planck length is the unique length constructible from the fundamental constants of quantum mechanics (ℏ), relativity (c), and gravitation (G). It represents the scale where quantum gravitational effects become dominant.
